snippet: Gen. Wesley K. Clark and Philip A. Karber say that equipment like body armor and night goggles could help Ukraine face a Russian attack.
abstract: Report by former NATO commander Wesley K Clark and Pentagon official Phillip A Karber argues that United States should provide Ukraine with nonlethal military aid like body armor and night vision goggles to help it defend against potential Russian attack; Obama administration, wary of provocation, has so far been reluctant to provide this assistance.
lead_paragraph: Gen. Wesley K. Clark and Philip A. Karber say that equipment like body armor and night goggles could help Ukraine face a Russian attack.

headline.main: General and Former Defense Official Urge Nonlethal Military Aid for Ukraine
headline.print_headline: General and Former Defense Official Urge Nonlethal Military Aid for Ukraine

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
